page.title: 13Mrs French remembers 2
page.content: As a girl she went to Coventry about once a year on a{carrier's cart}over bumpy stone roads steamrollered flat. The first{car}came to Shilton at about 1912.It was owned by{Mr.Adams of Ansty {Hall.Buses}first came in the early {1920s.}They stopped anywhere, except on hills! Mrs.French's family were railway workers.She could get quarter price return to{Rugby}for 4.5d from{Shilton. { Mains Electricity}came to{Shilton}in the early{1920s.}At that time there was a doctor in Shilton who also mixed medicines.It cost 12.5p(half a crown)to call out the doctor and 18d to see him in the surgery.For minor illnesses people prefered to buy {herbal remedies}from a shop in {Nuneaton. She liked walking,biking,and dancing , but had little spare time {.
